file_content.text: Thank you for your help.
You're back! Please tell me you've found him. Tell me you've found our son!
Calm down, Ellis. Let the stranger breathe.
Will you please tell my wife that our son is dead and have done with it?
Your son's dead. I'm sorry.
[Lie] I have bad news.
Oh no. Oh, Iero! He's dead!
He's alive. He's been forced to fight for the separatists.
Actually, he's not dead.
What? Don't spread lies like that! My son would never do such a thing. But if it's true--then my son is dead to me! Dead!
Sorry, I couldn't find him.
[Lie] I didn't learn anything.
Oh. Oh. Oh. He's dead, isn't he? He's dead.
He left Ord Mantell, and he wanted me to give you this.
Your son's alive but far away.
Oh, it's the ring I gave him when he was little. He gave you this so I'd know he was okay? He was always so thoughtful.
I wonder why he left Ord Mantell?
Does this look like it's your son's?
Is this ring familiar?
Oh, it's the ring I gave him when he was little. He gave you this so I'd know he was okay? How thoughtful of him. He was always so thoughtful.
I wonder why he didn't just come back to us.
Oh, Ellis, it's probably better if we didn't know.
He's dead, but I found this.
[Lie] I'm sorry. He's gone.
My son's ring! Oh no! He's dead. He's really dead. Oh no!
Oh, Ellis. Please don't cry. For the last five years, we believed him dead. We should be used to it by now.
Don't you worry about her. She needs time. Here are the credits my wife promised in her frenzy. Thank you for your help.
It was nothing.
Hey, I got my credits.
I'm satisfied.
Well, thank you anyway.
I'm sorry I couldn't bring your son back.
I wish I could've done more.
Don't worry about it. We've already had five years of believing the worst.
Hurry up and find my son!
Ellis, dear, stop overreacting. We don't know it was him, and I don't see the use of bothering a stranger about it.
You're too cold, Iero. This is our son we're talking about! He could be alive and on that island--and you don't care.
That's not true! I just don't see the point in getting our hopes up or in wasting other peoples' time.
Oh, Iero, there are plenty of people here who could help! Like this soldier--here! You! You look like you could help us. We have the credits.
I live to serve.
How can I assist?
We wouldn't waste anyone's time--we'll pay. We have the credits. There are guns-for-hire everywhere. Like... you! Could you help us?
Tell me what the problem is, and I'll see what I can do.
I need more details.
I'm not sure I'm who you want.
I believe you said something about credits....
Did you mention money?
Don't listen to her. We don't need your help.
My wife's chasing phantoms, that's all. A friend of hers thought she saw our son on Mannett Point, but my wife knows quite well that our son is dead.
Iero! Jenna's our friend, and if she says she saw him on Mannett Point, I believe her. She knew him as a boy. She wouldn't make that kind of mistake.
Please, you must help us.
One thing at a time.
This is nothing you need to concern yourself about. My wife is simply hysterical, that's all.
How can you be so cruel?
No thank you.
I'm sure you do. Ellis, please calm down--you're making fools of us.
It's our son we're talking about. Listen to me, stranger. Please.
Payment up front.
Credits! How ridiculous.
Shut up, Iero. Of course we'll pay. I want to know if my son really is alive, and I want him back if he is!
Our son was taken from us years ago when the separatists raided our home. My callous husband would rather believe he's dead, but I can't bear the thought.
Our friend says she saw him. Oh, I must know if it's true!
What do you need?
It must've been terrible, losing your son.
You must be in pain.
Oh yes. But I've never given up hope.
Maybe you need to let go.
Perhaps you should move on.
How can a mother let go of hope for her own son?
Jenna said she saw him at Mannett Point. Please, will you go look for him? I'd give anything to have him back safe.
I'll do it.
Have the money ready.
We'll see.
Oh, thank you, thank you! His name is Paul--the spitting image of his father. You can't help but recognize him!
Why must you indulge her?
I have an indulgent personality.
I'm a nice person.
Why must you be so callous?
You're cruel.
I'm not callous. I just won't torment myself with false hope.
I don't see the harm in it.
Why not?
Well, it's your time, I suppose.
This war has cost us everything. Everything.
